headline: Alasdair Gray, Scottish Writer of Daring, Dreamlike Tales, Dies at 85
abstract: He didn’t publish his first novel (which he illustrated himself) until he was 46. But his impact, as both a writer and an artist, has lasted.
lead_paragraph: Alasdair Gray, who wrote some of Scotland’s most celebrated — and strange — fiction, which he often interlaced with his own sharply etched illustrations, died on Dec. 29 at a hospital in Glasgow. He was 85.
keywords: Lanark: A Life in Four Books (Book)
